channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Google says the Pixel 5a 5G is coming this year despite cancelation rumors
item.description: However, it'll only be available in the US and Japan due to a global chip shortage.

item.title: A manufacturing issue has pulled some Boeing 737 Max planes from service
item.description: It was only late last year that the Boeing 737 Max returned to service, but the long-troubled passenger jet has run into another problem.

item.title: 'Super Meat Boy Forever' comes to PlayStation and Xbox on April 16th
item.description: The platforming sequel is also on the way to Steam later this year.

item.title: How gadgets could open the potential of lucid dreaming
item.description: Recent experiments show we can learn in our dreams. What else could we do with the right technology?

item.title: Amazon warehouse workers in Alabama vote against unionization
item.description: Amazon is on track to beat back the historic unionization attempt at its BHM1 fulfillment center in Bessemer, Alabama.

item.title: Robosen Robotics' Optimus Prime collectible responds to voice commands
item.description: Robosen Robotics has teamed up with Hasbro to build a programmable Optimus Prime collectible.

item.title: This week's best deals: Over 50 percent off Beats' Solo Pro headphones and more
item.description: Here's a list of the best tech deals from this week, including more than 50 percent off Beats' Solo Pro headphones and the lowest price ever on Apple's MacBook Air M1.

item.title: Twitch viewership more than doubled over the last year
item.description: Twitch viewership has doubled in the space of a year thanks to the pandemic, and rivals like YouTube have also grown.

item.title: Learn to design video games by mastering the Unity Engine
item.description: This eight-course bundle has 141 hours of content teaching you everything you need to know to start designing games in the Unity Engine using C#, Python, Blender and more.

item.title: Study suggests Facebook shows users different job ads based on their gender
item.description: Gender identity seemed to impact whether someone saw an employment ad for NVIDIA or Netflix.

item.title: Google's Phone app can automatically record calls from unknown numbers
item.description: Google is rolling out an update to its Phone app that lets you automatically record calls from unknown numbers.

item.title: Spotify explains how its voice assistant uses your data
item.description: Spotify has outlined how its 'Hey Spotify' voice assistant works, including how it uses your data.

item.title: Can a gaming mouse filled with holes really be water resistant?
item.description: SteelSeries' Aerox 3 Wireless is an ultra-light gaming mouse full of holes that shakes off water like a duck.

item.title: Engadget Podcast: Michio Kaku on 'The God Equation,' LG gives up on phones
item.description: This week, we explore why the Biden admission is bringing on Big Tech critics like Lina Khan and Tim Wu. It seems like they're gearing up to regulate the tech world even more.

item.title: GE is working to put COVID-19 virus-detecting sensors in phones
item.description: Scientists at GE Research have been awarded a grant to develop tiny sensors that can be embedded inside phones to identify COVID-19 particles on surfaces.

item.title: The Morning After: Netflix made a major movie deal with Sony Pictures
item.description: Neuralink plugged a monkey's brain into Pong, and also other things happened.

item.title: Google's Nest Thermostat is the cheapest it's ever been
item.description: Amazon has a new deal on Google's latest Nest Thermostat that cuts $30 off its original price.

item.title: Samsung’s iTest offers a look at Galaxy Android on iPhone
item.description: If you're using an iPhone and thinking about switching to a Galaxy device, Samsung has unveiled a website to let you "sample the other side."

item.title: Outriders' first big patch addresses inventory wiping bugs and crashes
item.description: 'Outriders' is getting its first big patch to fix some of its crashes and bugs including an issue that wiped players' inventories.

item.title: Rumors claim Samsung will make OLED TVs with LG panels next year
item.description: A big shakeup might be coming to the AV world as Samsung may start producing OLED TVs with panels sourced by rival LG, according to a report from Korean broadcaster MTN.

item.title: Toyota's new Mirai and Lexus LS models come with Advanced Drive assistance tech
item.description: Toyota has launched Advanced Drive, a new driver assistance technology, with the latest Toyota Mirai and Lexus LS vehicles.

item.title: Fire risk makes Verizon recall 2.5 million Ellipsis Jetpack mobile hotspots
item.description: Verizon has issued a recall for 2.5 million Jetpack mobile hotspots after receiving 15 reports of instances wherein the device overheated.

item.title: Neuralink's brain-computer interface demo shows a monkey playing Pong
item.description: Elon Musk's Neuralink is building brain-computer interfaces, like the one that allows this monkey to control a game of Pong with its thoughts.

item.title: Microsoft is finally releasing a 64-bit version of OneDrive for Windows
item.description: The new version of OneDrive will help those who need to transfer large files or many files since 64-bit systems can access more resources than their 32-bit counterparts.

item.title: Facebook was down
item.description: After a brief outage, Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp are available once again.
